intro: Palafoxia arenaria, commonly known as sand palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species that thrives in sandy and well-drained soils. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered with fine hairs. It is adapted to coastal and dune environments, making it a hardy species in harsh, dry conditions.
